asset-ification¶

Created by Benjamin M. Gross

Note

General Convention for asset_ification

When passing around HDFStore to and from functions, the store is left open if the function does not complete. For this reason (and until I figure out a better fix) the general convention is that functions are passed pandas.Series of training data (tickers, and asset classes) and str of the paths that lead to stores, so if there is any error with the function, the HDFStore can be closed within the exception

Returns the adjusted R-Squared for multivariate regression

asset_ification.asset_ification.adj_r2_uv(x, y)[source]¶

Returns the adjusted R-Squared for multivariate regression

asset_ification.asset_ification.append_store_prices(ticker_list, store_path, start='01/01/1990')[source]¶

Given an existing store located at path, check to make sure the tickers in ticker_list are not already in the data set, and then insert the tickers into the store.

ARGS:

ticker_list: list of tickers to add to the pandas.HDStore

store_path: string of the path to the pandas.HDStore

start: string of the date to begin the price data
RETURNS:
NoneType but appends the store and comments the

successes ands failures
asset_ification.asset_ification.clean_dates(arr_a, arr_b)[source]¶

Return the intersection of two pandas objects, either a pandas.Series or a pandas.DataFrame

ARGS:arr_a: pandas.DataFrame or pandas.Series arr_b: pandas.DataFrame or pandas.Series
RETURNS:pandas.DatetimeIndex of the intersection of the two pandas objects

Yes, I’m officially losing my mind, but who isn’t. I mean, why shouldn’t I compare the out of sample performance of a 338 dimensional svm with my knn algorithm... makes total sense, fuck off

asset_ification.asset_ification.complete_etf_list(write_path=None)[source]¶

www.price-data.com has pages with all of the etf tickers available on it. This function acesses each of those pages, stores the values to pandas.DataFrame and saves to file

ARGS:write_path: string of the path to save the DataFrame of tickers as a .csv If None is provided, only the pandas.DataFrame will be returned
asset_ification.asset_ification.create_data_store(ticker_list, store_path)[source]¶

Creates the ETF store to run the training of the logistic classificaiton tree

ARGS:

ticker_list: iterable of tickers

store_path: str of path to HDFStore
asset_ification.asset_ification.first_valid_date(prices)[source]¶

Helper function to determine the first valid date from a set of different prices Can take either a dict of pandas.DataFrame`s where each key is a ticker's 'Open', 'High', 'Low', 'Close', 'Adj Close' or a single :class:`pandas.DataFrame where each column is a different ticker

ARGS:prices: either dictionary or pandas.DataFrame
RETURNS:pandas.Timestamp
asset_ification.asset_ification.lnchg_nearest_neighbors(price_series, store_path, trained_series)[source]¶

Calculate the “nearest neighbors” on trained asset class data to determine probabilities the series belongs to given asset classes

ARGS:

series: pandas.Series of prices

store_path: string of a store path or an actual store of the trained asset class prices (each ticker should also appear in the .csv located at training_file_path

training_series: series where Index is the tickers and the values are the asset classes
asset_ification.asset_ification.model_accuracy_crosstab(trained_series, store_path, calc_meth)[source]¶

Calculate the model accuracy (returned as a confusion matrix) of asset classes that are already known, provided in the training_series.

ARGS:

store_path: string to the HDFStore of asset

training_series: series where Index is the tickers and the values are the asset classes
RETURNS:

pandas.DataFrame of the confusion matrix

Helper function for both of the model accuracy functions

ARGS:

store_path: str pointing to the HDFStore of trained data

asset_ification.asset_ification.r2_uv(x, y)[source]¶

Returns the R-Squared or Coefficient of Determination for a univariate regression (does not adjust for more independent variables

See also

r_squared_adjusted()

ARGS:

series: :class`pandas.Series` of prices

benchmark: :class`pandas.Series` of prices to regress series against
RETURNS:

float: of the coefficient of variation

asset_ification.asset_ification.setup_trained_hdfstore(trained_data, store_path)[source]¶

The HDFStore doesn’t work properly when it’s compiled by different versions, so the appropriate thing to do is to setup the trained data locally (and not store the .h5 file on GitHub).

ARGS:

trained_data: pandas.Series with tickers in the index and asset classes for values

store_path: str of where to create the HDFStore
asset_ification.asset_ification.tickers_to_dict(ticker_list, api='yahoo', start='01/01/1990')[source]¶

Utility function to return ticker data where the input is either a ticker, or a list of tickers.

ARGS:

ticker_list: list in the case of multiple tickers or str in the case of one ticker

api: string identifying which api to call the data from. Either ‘yahoo’ or ‘google’

start: string of the desired start date
RETURNS:

dictionary of (ticker, price_df) mappings or a pandas.DataFrame when the ticker_list is str
asset_ification.asset_ification.update_store_prices(store_path)[source]¶

Update to the most recent prices for all keys of an existing store, located at path path.

ARGS:store_path: string the location of the HDFStore file
RETURNS:NoneType but updates the HDF5 file, and prints to screen which values would not update
